abstract: Baghdad Journal; Haji Hussein, kebab restaurant in Falluja, Iraq that became a favorite of locals, travelers, journalists and even American soldiers over many years, was forced to relocate to Baghdad after falling to Islamic State in 2014; much-loved Falluja restaurant, so crowded patrons waited on line most nights to get in, had survived bomb damage multiple times, and once was even destroyed completely by an American airstrike.
lead_paragraph: Long before it became a haven for jihadists, the city of Falluja was known as the home of the Haji Hussein restaurant, where locals, soldiers, tourists and businessmen all ate.

headline.main: Falluja Restaurant Is Reborn in Baghdad, Offering Nostalgia With Its Kebab
headline.print_headline: Kebab and Nostalgia at a Falluja Transplant

snippet: Long before it became a haven for jihadists, the city of Falluja was known as the home of the Haji Hussein restaurant, where locals, soldiers, tourists and businessmen all ate.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
